pageContext.claim: “New Fox Poll: 58% of people say that the FBI broke the law in investigating Donald J. Trump.”
pageContext.analysis: Actually, the poll said it was "at least somewhat likely" the FBI broke the law when it first started investigating the Trump campaign, with 20 percent saying it was "somewhat likely." Moreover, "when asked who they trust more to tell the truth, voters pick [special counsel Robert] Mueller over Trump (by 45-27 percent), Mueller over Attorney General William Barr (by 40-22 percent), and Congressional Democrats over the administration (by 44-33 percent)."
